title: The big WAIT
body: It's like the big sleep, only longer and with hideous Smashmouth music playing in the background.
author: Dan

comments.author: C
comments.body: crossable bits remain so cross-ed, but do please turn that music down.

comments.author: Mark
comments.body:
>> Positive Vibes >>

I've really enjoyed reading your blog, but I think it's started affecting me. The other night I dreamt I built my own cinema at the bottom of my garden. I don't even have a garden. Still, it was a cool little cinema...
M

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
C: I can't! The nob is stuck! AHHH... please make it stop...

Mark: Thanks for the "positive vibes" package. Perhaps your dream is telling you something, like "plant a garden next year" or "there's a $5 bill in the front pocket of the pants that just went in the wash."

comments.author: Einahpets
comments.body: A garden theater. I like it!

comments.author: justin
comments.body: Don't lie, Dan.  You love Smashmouth.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Yes, you're right. That reminds me... I have several of your Smashmouth CDs that I need to get back to you. Do you want the dolls back too?

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: Smashmouth? We don't listen to Smashmouth. It's only Barenaked Ladies in our car and apartment.

comments.author: Einahpets
comments.body: But whenever we all hang out we have Five for Fighting sing offs...

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Oh man, this is starting to get embarassing.

comments.author: Newell
comments.body: Try playing the song 'Banana Phone' by Raffi. That'll knock out anything else.

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: Raffi! Dan yells at me when I sing Baby Beluga.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: This is turning into a pack of lies. All lies I tell ye. LIES!!!

comments.author: Tim
comments.body: I'll send that Celine Dion/Anne Geddes CD over now...

comments.author: Brandon
comments.body:
"Every morning there's a halo hanging from the corner of my girlfriend's four-post bed..."

We all can dream, can't we?  Mine just isn't about gardens.
